column1: Issue 22 of the Lego City Comic comes with two sets attached.
column2: The new set exclusive to this issue contains Jack Lumber, and he comes with his power saw, log and cradle.&nbsp
column3: I also got the first space set to be attached to the Lego City Comic 951908, which does not really compliment this set but if you started collecting from Issue 21 it would be great to add to your collection.

column1: The foil packet shows off the contents well and as ever indicates that this is not for under 6'
column3: A generic construction worker is pictured in the top right corner adjacent to the Lego and City logo&#39

column1: On the back there is a 1:1 image of the red cone that makes up part of the saw.
column2: Most of the back is taken up with the standard copyright and safety information.&nbsp
column3: I personally feel that these packets are too large for what they contain.

column1: Jack Lumber is the latest addition to the Lego City Comic.
column2: His attire is well suited as he sports eye protection and a hi-visibility vest over his brown shirt.&nbsp
column3: His unprinted legs are Sand Blue and can be found in 91 sets, so are very common.&nbsp
column5: is Bright Orange and printed front and back and has appeared in twelve sets since 2015 that range in value.
column6: The arms are Reddish Brown and he has Dark Stone Grey gloves.&nbsp
column7: Mini Head 914 suits Jack very well but as this is quite a common part, appearing in 41 sets since 2015, it would be great to get a less used part.&nbsp
column8: Jack is also wearing a very common Bright Red helmet.

column1: Sometimes these sets give you some rare pieces, but that is not the case here.
column4: been used previously, and the log is only four 2x2 round bricks put together.&nbsp
column5: The stand is solid enough and adds a play value.&nbsp
column6: The build of non-Minifigure element is only 13 pieces so won&#39

column3: two sets and a comic is certainly good value, and if you already own 60059 and 60181 then this will compliment them perfectly.
column4: It seems strange that Jack has appeared now as the recent wave of City Lego excludes anything that is of this kind.&nbsp
column5: However, as I write this the London Toy Fair is going on, so maybe there are sets to be released later in 2020 that will match the theme nicely.&nbsp

column1: With what has been released in January 2020 I would like to see the Lego Comic provide something to go with the tuning/performance vehicles.
column2: I would particularly like to see a safari issue of the comic too, which could come with a Minifigure and animal.
January 2020 the next issue is available and will contain yet another police set.
